audit_entry_form.aef_subtxt: The test evaluates websites based on efficiency, sustainability, openness, and security. In the last {{time}} hours, {{requests}} new audits have been performed. The number of requests is limited to {{limit}} per {{time}} hours. Learn more about the project here. Details on calculation and measurement can be found in the documentation.

card_1.title: Digital Footprint
card_1.text: The internet consumes about 10% of the world's electricity. This is roughly equivalent to the carbon footprint of global aviation.

card_2.title: Speed Matters
card_2.text: 53% of mobile users leave a website if it takes longer than 3 seconds to load. Efficiency not only saves energy but also retains visitors.

card_3.title: Barriers on the Web
card_3.text: Over 96% of the most visited websites have accessibility errors. Open standards are the foundation of an inclusive internet.

card_4.title: Data Load from Images
card_4.text: Images often account for over 60% of a website's data weight. Optimized formats reduce power consumption with every page view.

card_5.title: Security as a Standard
card_5.text: Nearly 95% of web traffic via Google is now encrypted. A secure connection is the basic requirement for trust in the digital space.

card_6.title: Visibility through Performance
card_6.text: Google uses loading time (Core Web Vitals) as an official ranking factor. ECOS-compliant websites receive preferential treatment in search results.

card_7.title: Energy Hunger of Search Queries
card_7.text: A single search query consumes as much energy as a 60-watt light bulb needs for about 17 seconds. Lean code minimizes this effort.

card_8.title: Hidden Code Ballast
card_8.text: On average, 40% of the transferred JavaScript on a website is not used at all. Removing 'dead code' is the fastest way to increase efficiency.

card_9.title: Hosting with Foresight
card_9.text: Data centers require enormous amounts of water for cooling. A 'green hosting' provider pays attention to both electricity and the water footprint.

card_10.title: Security through Updates
card_10.text: Over 40% of all cyberattacks target small and medium-sized enterprises. Regular security audits are the best protection against automated bots.

card_11.title: Video Traffic
card_11.text: Online videos cause around 60% of global data traffic. Compression and lazy loading are crucial for a site's CO2 balance.

card_12.title: Mobile First as a Standard
card_12.text: Over 55% of worldwide traffic comes from mobile devices. Efficient programming saves not only data volume but also the battery life of users.

card_13.title: Inclusion as an Economic Factor
card_13.text: People with disabilities and their families possess immense purchasing power. Accessible (Open) websites tap into this often ignored target group.

card_14.title: The Price of Fonts
card_14.text: Web fonts are often responsible for high loading times. Using system fonts or WOFF2 formats can reduce font file sizes by up to 50%.

card_15.title: Dark Mode for Energy Efficiency
card_15.text: On OLED displays, Dark Mode can reduce screen power consumption by up to 60%. A simple CSS feature with a big impact.

card_16.title: Trust through Transparency
card_16.text: 73% of users state they trust brands more when they are transparent about their data and standards. 'Open' also means trustworthiness.

card_17.title: Streaming Emissions
card_17.text: One hour of HD video streaming causes about 160g of CO2. Efficient web architectures help limit data throughput to the essentials.
